snippet: Rachel Harrison’s sculptures seem to acknowledge the reascendancy of abstraction on the art market, while suggesting that a once-vital Modernist mode is badly in need of cleaning and pepping up.
abstract: Holland Cotter reviews sculptures by Rachel Harrison at Greene Naftali gallery.
lead_paragraph: Rachel Harrison’s sculptures seem to acknowledge the reascendancy of abstraction on the art market, while suggesting that a once-vital Modernist mode is badly in need of cleaning and pepping up.
